title: Recent Thunderbird Update now downloads deleted messages from Gmail
content:
First, here's how I process incoming email, which first goes to my Gmail address. I delete about half of my messages unread, and about one-quarter more after reading/scanning them. The remainder are then downloaded after I open TB on my Windows PC and select Get Mail (F5).

'Until about Aug. 20, everything worked as planned, even though TB was also downloading some of my Sent messages.

But since then, with no setup changes made by me, TB also includes ALL the messages that I previously deleted at the Gmail site. So I must delete them again, a tedious, annoying process. Experimenting, I overcame the problem by permanently deleting the trashed messages at Gmail before launching TB. It also amount to double deleting, but it is much faster that way.

WHAT MUST I DO to restore the previous functionality of this process?

I'm not a techie, but began using Eudora over 25 years ago, so PLEASE don't replies with guesses.
creator: larry41

title: Thunderbird 115.13.0 (64 bit) Linux Mint cannot receive the Greek alphabet letters I sent from Gmail
content:
I use Greek letters Omega (Ω) and mu (μ) in electronics discussion, where the Greek Omega (Ω) is the symbol for "ohms" of electrical resistance to the flow of current, and Greek mu (μ) stands in for "micro" or millionths of an ampere of current (1μA is 1/1000,000th of an ampere of current flow).

I sent an email to others and my email account on which I use Thunderbird Mail (version 115.13.0 on Linux Mint). I artfully spelled in all caps the word "Communicator," using the Ω sign in the place of "O" and the μ sign in the place of a "U." I received the word with this spelling: "C?MM?NICATOR"

Checking in Firefox on my Gmail account's Sent folder, I found the Greek letters in good order. Firefox can use UTF-8 encoding.

I found a solved thread on the Stack Exchange. Look under Tools • Options, as it is in Windows, but in Linux that's Edit • Preferences • Display. I have neither Options nor Preferences in this version of Thunderbird, nor can I find anything about setting encoding in Edit • Settings. I should set encoding from Western to UTF-8 on both incoming and outgoing mail to see foreign characters.

Some info about my installations of Firefox and Thunderbird here: In order to not lose my profile when I need to reinstall Linux for whatever reason, I have both Profiles stored on an outboard disk that is treated as a permanent disk on the system. This move also gives the profiles room to expand as needed

Linux Mint 21.3 Cinnamon 64-bit MintBox Mini 2 Pro by CompuLab No longer on Amazon, but info here at the Linux Mint store .

So I ask, "Where to from here?"
creator: FirefoxinUbuntu

title: Purple Folders - cause identified
content:
This relates to question #1438542 Purple Folders https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1438542 which has been archived. The OP had folders whose icons had changed color to purple - the same as Drafts. The solution was to download the add-on folderflags, drag the .xpi file onto the add-ons manager, confirm the install, then on each folder, right-click and select Properties, then use the new Flags tab to switch off the Draft flag.

There are two things that I'd like to add to that solution:

  1. After changing the flags, I had to restart TB for the folder icon colors to go back to their normal yellow. Note that one of my affected folders had also moved immediately after Local Folders / Drafts folder. After switching off the flag and restarting TB, that folder also went back to its normal alphabetical order position.
  2. The OP didn't know what was causing the folders to be marked as Draft. I can reproduce the problem by these steps:
  • Start a new message, type some text.
  • In the menu bar, select Options > Send a copy to > select a folder
  • Save the message - this immediately adds the Draft flag in the selected folder.

Many thanks to Thomas for asking the original question, and contributor Matt who provided the solution.
creator: tony3121

title: Need to get address books from partial profile backup after Windows failure
content:
Hi. My windows 10 PC failed to boot a few days ago and after a long period of trying to salvage it, I wound up having to reset the Windows OS on it (Go figure) and that of course resulted in the loss of all of my 3rd party software and applications.

I have since restored the PC and and the My Thunderbird email software. I did have a backup of my profile of sorts from a few months ago when I was forced to migrate email ISP companies from Cox Communications to Yahoo when Cox left the email industry last spring. I say 'of sorts' because I only kept the file structure from the actual profile down vice from Thunderbird down. And even if I had done that, it wouldn't work well since I copied out the profile before the switch to Yahoo, so the email accounts have the old Cox server info not the current Yahoo ones.

I have come to terms with the email loss and I did take the opportunity to switch from POP3 to IMAP something I have been meaning to do for a while now. And I was able to copy over the Local Folders , so it's not all gloom and doom. But what I really need to get is the address book. I have tired to import it using the "import from another Thunderbird Installation" but that ended with an error condition. Is it possible to copy the address book from one profile to another?

Oh and one last thing, Thank you for the ISP configuration data base that T'bird used to auto-configure the IMAP server setups. It made life much easier.

Thanks for any help. Respectfully Mark B.
creator: jmbrocky

title: Thunderbird doesn’t get messages from pop3 accounts, only imap
content:
Ubuntu 24.04, Thunderbird 128.1.0esr (64-bit)

I have a mix of POP and IMAP accounts. All are read when starting Thunderbird, I receive the messages. But then, only the IMAP accounts get the messages, whatever the configuration of the Server Settings. I.e. no messages for the POP accounts from "Check for new messages every X minutes", nor from "Get Messages". I have to restart Thunderbird to get the new messages for the POP accounts.

Everything worked well before, this problem happens since I have upgraded Xubuntu from 22.04 to 24.04, where the Thunderbird package switched to a mandatory Snap, where it upgraded to 128.1.0.

title: Viewing the filter log (again)
content: Running Thunderbird 128.1.1esr (64-bit) for Linux Mint (mint-001 - 1.0) on a Linux Mint 22 Wilma system. When I click Message Filters and then Filter Log, I do not actually see the filter log, only a check box to enable it, which is already checked" - same as https://support.mozilla.org/kn/questions/1438189 I noticed it today and, as I normally check the filterlog on my primary (POP3) account about once a week, it would appear to have only started happening recently. I checked the filterlog.html files for all of my accounts - they all looked OK. Went through TB Clear Log, Close for all of them, quit TB, reload TB, same as before. filterlogs not showing. Cleared 'Enable the Filter Log', quit TB, deleted filterlogs from profiles, reload TB, enabled filterlogs, quit TB, filterlogs had been recreated in profiles by TB. Reload TB, moved some filtered mails back to inbox, ran filters again, they had been moved from inbox to deleted, showed when filterlog.html viewed in Firefox but still not showing in TB via Message Filters and Filter Log. All help greatly appreciated.
creator: john.haggerty

title: inbox verdwenen na upgrade naar Noble 24.04.1 LTS
content: Vanochtend kreeg ik een melding dat ik kon upgraden naar een nieuwe Ubuntu LTS versie. Omdat ik vandaag een tijd van huis zou gaan leek me dat een goed moment, zodat de computer lekker zijn gang kon gaan. Ik was alleen te veel in goed vertrouwen dat alles goed zou gaan, en in strijd met mijn gewoonte maakte ik niet eerst een backup van alles op mijn externe harddrive. Toen ik de upgrade had gedaan (naar Noble 24.04.1 LTS) werkte Firefox weer prima, maar bij het openen van Thunderbird moest ik tot mijn verbazing mijn mailadres en wachtwoord ingeven. Nadat ik dat had gedaan, kreeg ik een totaal lege mailbox te zien, waarin mijn andere accounts ook allemaal verdwenen waren. Er kwam wel meteen een nieuw mailtje binnen, maar ik kan met geen mogelijkheid al mijn oude mails terug vinden. Zoals ik al schreef had ik van te voren dus geen backup gemaakt dit keer. Opvallend is dat mijn adresboek wèl bewaard is gebleven (hoewel nu niet meer met onderverdeling maar in één grote groep); het zijn puur de mailboxen zelf die spoorloos zijn. Met uiteraard veel belangrijke zaken, zoals mails waar ik nog op moest reageren en belangrijke correspondentie. Ik hoop dat het toch nog lukt om de mailbox terug te vinden, want je zou verwachten dat die gegevens niet zomaar weggegooid of overschreven worden.
creator: erik103

title: Moving Profiles between Desktop and Laptop IE Home DT and Travel LP
content:
We travel to FL for winter months and occasionally North for summer. In the past we have had no problem moving our profile between the two systems. This spring when we returned from FL, when the Profile was put on the DT at home, we saw major differences. We had always dealt with POP systems so we stored all email on a local system. We, my wife and I, have 5 different email addresses, all of which WERE on the same inbox. After this spring move to DT, all 5 had different accounts and inboxes. After this, our old inbox was stored in Local Folders. This we could live with. BUT

The remainder of our local folders were incomplete. We had about 1/3 of what was on the Laptop available on the Desktop. There was an unused Profile that had all of the Local Folder folders in it. It had taken me about of month to explore the difference, we had other things to do including an emergency trip back to FL to determine whether our condo was flooded with sewage as our next door neighbors was. It wasn't!!

So, I have tried a simple copy and paste to move the many missing Local Folders, both mozmsgs and sbd, to no avail. Is it possible to update my current Profile with the older info. It appears both DT and LT are the same version of Thunderbird. If so - please help this old computer hobbyist. I started in 78 with an IMSAI and CP/M writing printer drivers in assembly. Since then, a lot has happened and I'm no longer "up to date".

Dan Schuder dschuder11@gmail.com
creator: dschuder11

title: Can't send messages
content:
I recently upgraded my computer and re-installed Thunderbird with my several e-mail accounts. Somewhere, while setting up my various accounts, I used a comma (,) instead of a dot (.) in the account name; i.e. cxxx,xx@comcast.net instead of cxxx.xx@comcast.net. Now, when I try to send a message from that account I get the error message shown below. Receiving messages is not affected. My equipment is a Dell Optiplex 7010, 13th generation i7 CPU (x64), 16 Gb RAM, Windows 11 Pro, Thunderbird 128.1.1esr (64-bit). I cannot find a location or means to correct the comma vs. dot error anywhere in my Comcast account or in Thunderbird. What do you suggest? Thanks... Jim <jmcarp43@gmail.com>

Error message (can't send full screen shot):

Login to server smtp.comcast.net with username carp,jm@comcast.net failed.
